definition: to continue in one's own way (idiom)
to continue in one's own way (idiom)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love

sentences.english: It was easily good enough for pole so that was the main thing.
sentences.chinese: 那一圈跑得不錯，足以使我獲得杆位，那是最主要的。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, I'm not in a position to help you financially.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，我沒辦法在財務上幫你忙。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, I'm not in a position to help you financially.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，我沒辦法在財務上幫你忙。

sentences.english: To me, in the love of the river, I often feel like I was upstream .
sentences.chinese: 於我，在愛情的河流裏，我經常覺得自己在逆流而上。

sentences.english: To me, in the love of the river, I often feel like I was upstream .
sentences.chinese: 於我，在愛情的河流裏，我經常覺得自己在逆流而上。

sentences.english: I closed the window. I combed his long, black hair from his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 我關上窗，爲他梳理了額頭長長的黑髮。

sentences.english: I hadn't paid the telephone bill.
I grant that yours are of better quality.
sentences.chinese: 我授與你的是有較好的質量。

sentences.english: Would my take you hand, would you understand Just how I feel?
sentences.chinese: 我能牽起你的手感受我的內心嗎？

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看見你我太高興了，”嘉莉說，既高興又爲難。

sentences.english: Still, I'd like to see more innovation in content aggregators on the iPad.
sentences.chinese: 我依舊想在iPad內容聚合器上看到更多的創新。

sentences.english: You know, Uncle Brendan, I am really glad you invited me here.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，布萊登叔叔，我真的很高興你邀請我們來。

sentences.english: I screamed in pain as the knife cut the surface layer of my skin.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮膚被割開了，我痛苦的嘶叫着。

sentences.english: I screamed in pain as the knife cut the surface layer of my skin.
sentences.chinese: 我的皮膚被割開了，我痛苦的嘶叫着。

sentences.english: I used to go to work by bike. (But I don't anymore, now. )
sentences.chinese: 我過去常騎自行車上班。

sentences.english: So is it correct English to split infinitives?
sentences.chinese: 所以我的答案是可以拆分不定式。

definition: you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
